SENT.plain: In 48 patients that suffered subtotal esophagectomy and were submitted to esophagogastroplasty a long term follow-up study was carried out
In four of these patients (8.3%) pathological changes that characterize Barrett's esophagus were found in the esophageal stump
As far as we could verify, such changes were never reported at this localization before
The Barrett's esophagus seems to be intimately linked to reflux esophagitis resulting from the action of acid-peptic and biliary secretions
